framework.communication.internal.signal

Interface ISignalListener

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IController, IDataPipeline<T>, IModel, IView
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseController, BaseModel, DialogView, ExportDataBuilder, ExportImagesBuilder, LayersDialogView, PanelView, ProjectController, ProjectDialogView, ProjectModel, ProjectView, PropertiesController, PropertiesDialogView, PropertiesModel, SaveTileMapBuilder, ScrollView, TileLayerModel, TileLayersController, TileMapController, TileMapDialogView, TileMapModel, TileMapView, TileModel, TileView

    public interface ISignalListener
    This interface defines a methodology for communicating signals between different sub-systems using a signaling concept with a custom set of event arguments
    Author:
    Daniel Ricci <thedanny09@icloud.com>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String EVENT_REGISTER
      This event is used to signal listening entities that something would like to register to you.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_UNREGISTER
      This event is used to signal listening entities that something would like to unregister from you

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void addSignal(java.lang.String signalName, ISignalReceiver signalReceiver)
      Adds the specified signal and signal implementation to the list of available, invokable, signals
      default void clearSignals()
      Clears all the signals that have been registers to this listener
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SignalListenerContainer> getSignals()
      Gets the list of available signal that this listener has available
      default void invokeSignal(EventArgs signalEvent) 
      default void removeSignal(java.lang.String signalName)
      Removes the specied signal from the list of available, invokable, signals.
      default void setSignalEnabled(java.lang.String signalName, boolean isEnabled)
      Enabled/Disables the specified signal name.
      void update(EventArgs signalEvent)
      An update event that sub-systems can hook onto to perform an update, similar to update loops in a real-time simulation

    • Method Detail

      • addSignal

        default void addSignal(java.lang.String signalName,
                       ISignalReceiver signalReceiver)
        Adds the specified signal and signal implementation to the list of available, invokable, signals
        Parameters:
        signalName - The name of the signal
        signalReceiver - The signal implementation

      • clearSignals

        default void clearSignals()
        Clears all the signals that have been registers to this listener

      • setSignalEnabled

        default void setSignalEnabled(java.lang.String signalName,
                              boolean isEnabled)
        Enabled/Disables the specified signal name. When a signal is enabled, it can be invoked by callers, when it is disabled then it cannot be invoked by the signal listening system.
        Parameters:
        signalName - The name of the signal
        isEnabled - TRUE if the signal is enabled, FALSE otherwise

      • removeSignal

        default void removeSignal(java.lang.String signalName)
        Removes the specied signal from the list of available, invokable, signals.
        Parameters:
        signalName - The name of the signal

      • invokeSignal

        default void invokeSignal(EventArgs signalEvent)

      • getSignals

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SignalListenerContainer> getSignals()
        Gets the list of available signal that this listener has available
        Returns:
        A mapping of signal names to signal implementations

      • update

        void update(EventArgs signalEvent)
        An update event that sub-systems can hook onto to perform an update, similar to update loops in a real-time simulation
        Parameters:
        signalEvent - An event that holds information about the action being performed
